get.summary: Get a list of all available countries

get.description: Get specific group by its ID

delete.description: Delete group from access - soft delete which removes the group from use by updating it to be inactive

get.description: Looks up hierarchy by name, using the dataAttributeName or userAttributeName property of the hierarchy attribute

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the the hierarchy to be looked up

schema.description: isUserAttribute being set to true tells ACCESS to look up the hierarchy using the userAttributeName property rather than dataAttributeName

get.description: Get if SCIM is configured for the back end - i.e. an external IdP is being used to managed users

200.description: Successfully retrieved array of SCIM users

405.description: SCIM is not enabled, method not allowed
SCIM is not enabled, method not allowed

get.summary: Get specific SCIM user by UUID
get.description: Returns specific SCIM user based on specified UUID

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: user id to retrieve attributes for

405.description: SCIM is not enabled, method not allowed

delete.description: Deletes an existing SCIM user based on specified user ID

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: user identifier for user to be deleted

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: user identifier for user to be patched

put.summary: Patch an existing SCIM user via PUT

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: user identifier for user to be patched

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: name of the resource type to be looked up

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the schema to be looked up

405.description: SCIM currently enabled, create not allowed

get.description: Returns user based on specified ID

400.description: Failed to update user - invalid request

get.description: Returns user attributes based on specified email address
Returns details for the user querying

Operation failed / User object invalid / Operator not supported

description.example: Unique identifier for the User, typically used by the user to directly authenticate to the service provider. Each User MUST include a non-empty userName value. This identifier MUST be unique across the service provider's entire set of Users.
Authentication scheme using the HTTP Basic Standard
